data.message:
Jake Marsing shares what made it into his notebook today from #BroncosCamp. How did Brock Osweiler look with the first-team reps all day?

http://www.scout.com/nfl/broncos/story/1569878-denver-broncos-training-camp-notebook-day-4

The Denver Broncos went back to work Monday. 

Here's what we saw.

Although rest days and injury recoveries left the #Broncos' No. 1 defense without eight of its 11 expected starters on Monday, Brock Osweiler got extended work with most of the first-team offense. Aside from Peyton Manning, only Owen Daniels and Louis Vasquez were pulled. 

Perhaps most importantly, Osweiler got extended work with center Gino Gradkowski.

DAY 4 QUICK HITS: dbron.co/77n

I respect coach fox but when we had games in the bag he would rarely put brock in and only for handoff duty. Hopefully kubiak will let him air it out a little during the season.

I hope he gets to play when games are completely out of hand one way or another.

The Denver Broncos veterans get a chance to sit and watch the young kids make their mark. 

So who steps up?
O S W E I L E R !

Two young fans went to Denver Broncos camp as fans.
They left... as Peyton Manning's NEWEST WRs.

What. An. Experience.
Peyton has all the class in the world and great for kids!!!!!
Peyton Manning could throw Touchdown Passes to Monkeys with his eyes closed
Here come the Patriots fans to find a way to bash him about it. Don't be rude, he's doing something very nice. Have some class.
He's the MANning (betcha haven't heard that before)

What a sweet story. Getting picked for these events, he could have just given these kids the cold shoulder yet he gets out there. He's definitely a great one, and done with all the BS, trolls, and doubters as he is he'll be totally focused on overthrowing the reigning champs. 
For the kids, Peyton. I'm choking back my tears just thinking about it.

The Denver Broncos may be looking to add another former Kansas University football to the three they already have on their roster.

According to Mike Garafolo of FOX Sports, the Broncos recently hosted wide receiver Nigel King for a workout. Denver has a roster spot available after fifth-year pro Kyle Williams suffered a season-ending injury during a recent practice.
